page.title: 17LANGUAGE WE USE TODAY.
page.content: HERE ARE SOME DEFINITIONS OF THE WORDS WHICH WE USE IN SPEAKING.THESE ARE SLANG WORDS: [DEAF'EM]TO LEAVE A PERSON ON THEIR OWN AND NOT BE THEIR FRIEND. [DIV'EAD]SOMEONE WHO ACTS LIKE A FOOL, BEING SILLY. [DOSS]LAZING AROUND OR HAVING A GOOD TIME. [GAMBOLE]A FORWARD ROLL PERFORMED IN GYMNASTICS. [KNOCK]A FIGHT. [LEG IT]TO RUN AWAY. [RIP OFF]SOMEONE WHO HAS SOLD YOU SOMETHING FOR A PRICE IT IS NOT WORTH. [ROCKS]SWEETS. [SLOG IT]TO HIT A BALL REALLY HARD. [WAGGER]SOMEONE WHO HAS DAYS OFF SCHOOL OR WORK WHEN THEY ARE NOT ILL.
